customer_addr:
166 Oak Ridge Drive
CEDAR CREEK, TX 78612

citations.narrative:
The licensee moved their business to a new address. The licensee notified Animal Care of the move on March 23, 2023,
which, per the licensee, was not at least 90 days before they moved to the new address. The licensee has not obtained a
new license. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in
address. The licensee must not conduct any regulated activity until they have obtained a new license.
CORRECT BY: 4/10/2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not employ a full-time veterinarian and there was no written program of veterinary care for the licensee’s
new address and new veterinarian available at the time of inspection. The licensee had an old Program of Vet Care on
hand from her previous attending veterinarian but lacked a completed one for her new veterinarian. A written program of
veterinary care is required for facilities which do not employ a full-time veterinarian. The licensee, in coordination with the
attending veterinarian, must provide more specific information on the type of products used at the facility and the
frequency of use. This is not considered to be adequate veterinary care when information on how the licensee provides
veterinary care for all animals have not been recorded. The licensee must ensure that the program of veterinary care is
updated with current preventive practices to ensure that all animals are provided adequate veterinary care. The program
of veterinary care must be made available for review during inspections to ensure adequate veterinary care is being
provided.
COREECT BY: 4/10/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee moved their business to a new address. The licensee notified Animal Care of the move on March 23, 2023, 
which, per the licensee, was not at least 90 days before they moved to the new address. The licensee has not obtained a 
new license. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in 
address. The licensee must not conduct any regulated activity until they have obtained a new license.  
CORRECT BY: 4/10/2023. 
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility does not employ a full-time veterinarian and there was no written program of veterinary care for the licensee’s 
new address and new veterinarian available at the time of inspection. The licensee had an old Program of Vet Care on 
hand from her previous attending veterinarian but lacked a completed one for her new veterinarian. A written program of 
veterinary care is required for facilities which do not employ a full-time veterinarian. The licensee, in coordination with the 
attending veterinarian, must provide more specific information on the type of products used at the facility and the 
frequency of use. This is not considered to be adequate veterinary care when information on how the licensee provides 
veterinary care for all animals have not been recorded. The licensee must ensure that the program of veterinary care is 
updated with current preventive practices to ensure that all animals are provided adequate veterinary care. The program

of veterinary care must be made available for review during inspections to ensure adequate veterinary care is being 
provided. 
COREECT BY: 4/10/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
